standard.title: 6-Month Structured Plan (Recommended)
standard.description: The recommended pace for most aspirants. Balances depth with consistent progress. Includes spaced repetition for retention.

exam_details.part_1_weight: External Reporting (15%), Planning/Budgeting (20%), Performance (20%), Cost Management (15%), Internal Controls (15%), Tech/Analytics (15%)
exam_details.part_2_weight: F/S Analysis (25%), Corporate Finance (20%), Decision Analysis (20%), Risk Management (10%), Investment Decisions (15%), Ethics (10%)

weeks.topic: External Financial Reporting Decisions (15% of exam)
weeks.action: **Deep Dive:** Read notes. Focus on US GAAP vs IFRS differences. **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 100). Create flashcards for specific accounting treatments.
**Deep Dive:** Master the operating budget (start to finish). **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 150). **Practical:** Build a simple budget model in Excel to see the flow of numbers.
**Focus:** Variance Analysis (Price vs. Volume). **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 100). **Essay Prep:** Write down the management implications of a favorable vs. unfavorable variance.

**Focus:** Activity-Based Costing (ABC) vs. Traditional Costing. **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 100). **Active Recall:** Teach the difference between Job Order and Process Costing to a friend/out loud.
**Focus:** COSO Framework (Control Environment, Risk Assessment, etc.). **Practice:** 25 MCQs daily (Total 50). **Memorization:** Create a mnemonic for the components of COSO.
**Focus:** Big Data, Automation, and Data Visualization. **Practice:** 25 MCQs daily (Total 50). **Application:** Understand *how* these concepts impact the management accountant's role.

**Step 1:** Review all flashcards and weak areas from Weeks 1-11. **Step 2:** Take **Full Mock Exam 1** (Timed, 100 MCQs + 2 Essays). **Step 3:** Review wrong answers and identify why you got them wrong (content gap vs. misreading).
**Focus:** Ratio Analysis (Liquidity, Solvency, Profitability). **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 150). **Essay Prep:** Analyze a real company's 10-K and write a paragraph on its financial health.
**Focus:** Cost of Capital, CAPM, and Leverage. **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 150). **Active Recall:** Explain how debt financing impacts ROE (Trading on Equity).
**Focus:** CVP Analysis (Breakeven) and Marginal Analysis (Make vs. Buy). **Practice:** 50 MCQs daily (Total 100). **Practical:** Calculate the breakeven point for a hypothetical business.
**Focus:** Risk identification and mitigation strategies. **Practice:** 25 MCQs daily (Total 50). **Application:** Categorize risks (Strategic, Operational, Financial) from a business case.
**Focus:** NPV vs. IRR (calculations and conflicts). **Practice:** 25 MCQs daily (Total 50). **Essay Prep:** Write a recommendation to a CEO on which project to choose based on NPV.

**Focus:** IMA Statement of Ethical Professional Practice. **Practice:** Work through 5-7 complex ethical case studies. **Memorization:** Memorize the 4 ethical standards (Competence, Confidentiality, Integrity, Credibility).

**Step 1:** **Full Mock Exam 2** (Timed). **Step 2:** **Full Mock Exam 3** (Timed). **Step 3:** **Essay Practice:** Write 4 full essays under timed conditions. Focus on handwriting clarity and structuring your answer logically.

fast.title: 3-Month Fast Track (Intensive)
fast.description: Intensive plan for those with strong background or full-time study availability. Requires 4-6 hours daily.

weeks.action: **High Intensity:** Read chapters, watch lectures at 1.5x speed. MCQ: 50 per day.
**Application:** Build a budget. MCQ: 60 per day. Focus on accuracy, not speed yet.
**Focus:** Variance calculations. MCQ: 70 per day. Start a 'Formula Sheet'.
**Memorization:** COSO framework. MCQ: 50 per day. Essay: 1 structured response.
**Full Mock P1:** Timed conditions. Identify weak areas and re-read those sections.
**Focus:** Ratios & Trend Analysis. MCQ: 50 per day. Review P1 weak spots for 30 mins.
**Focus:** Cost of Capital. MCQ: 60 per day. Add to your 'Formula Sheet'.
**Focus:** CVP & Make vs. Buy. MCQ: 60 per day.
**Focus:** NPV/IRR Calculations. MCQ: 60 per day. Essay: 1 capital budget memo.
**Focus:** IMA Code & Risk Frameworks. MCQ: 50 per day. Memorize IMA standards.
**Full Mock P2:** Timed conditions. Review every wrong answer.
**Back-to-back Mocks:** Day 1: Mock P1. Day 2: Mock P2. Day 3: Review mistakes. Day 4-5: Light review of formulas. Day 6-7: Rest/Relax.

working.title: 9-Month Working Professional (Sustainable)
working.description: Paced for 1-2 hours on weekdays, 3-4 hours on weekends. Ideal for full-time employees.

weeks.action: **Slow & Steady:** Read 1 chapter per week. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Review flashcards and read next chapter.
**Weekend Deep Dives:** Spend 3 hours each Saturday mastering the Master Budget. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night.
**Practical Application:** Relate variances to your workplace if possible. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Drill variance formulas.
**Focus:** Overhead allocation. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Practice ABC vs. Traditional costing problems.
**Focus:** Sarbanes-Oxley and COSO. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night (focus on theory).
**Focus:** Data concepts. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Read articles on AI in accounting.
**Weekend:** Take **Mock Test 1**. Review answers Sunday night. Plan to re-study one weak topic next week.
**Analyzing Reports:** Find a public company's financials. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Calculate 5 key ratios for the company.
**Finance Management:** Focus on Working Capital. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Cost of Capital problems.
**Strategic Decisions:** Focus on CVP. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night. **Weekend:** Make vs. Buy analysis.
**Risk Frameworks:** Understand hedging. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night.
**Capital Budgeting:** Focus on NPV & Payback. **Weekdays:** 20 MCQs/night (Calculations).
**Ethics Code:** Read the IMA code twice. **Weekdays:** 15 MCQs/night (Scenarios).
**Week 35:** Mock Exam (Saturday) + Review (Sunday). **Week 36:** Light review of formulas, flashcards, and second mock if possible. Focus on sleep.
